The One Piece is everything Gol D. Roger, The King of the Pirates had claimed and he left it all for the first person who finds it.

topics.body: So I'm gonna talk about the art a bit. Raiku's early artwork is very unrefined. He has very expressive faces and that's a good match for the high energy pace of the series. But the characters bodies have this weird _retangular_ shape with the rest of their bodies. He uses a lot of soft line for the faces but the bodies use much straighter linework.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body: It feels like Kiyo is kind of like Anti-Luffy. Where as Luffy is happy, dumb, and can't go two hours without making more friends Kiyomaro is grumpy, smart, and anti-social as fuck.

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/543cb73b63687253317a0000#post_543cb73b63687253317a0000
[bq="Whatevs"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/543cb0f663687243ca620000#post_543cb0f663687243ca620000
enslaving Christians I imagine? Or Yzidis?[/bq]
Yzidis.

The *ONLY* good thing about ISIS is that the world has it's modern day villain to unite under.  I think 40 countries have so far united against ISIS with far more, even Iran may join the anti-ISIS fight, on the way.

I know it's a Godwin, but the anti-ISIS fight is shaping up militaristically like WW2 where nearly every god damn everyone unites against a small number of countries.  (Yes I know ISIS isn't a superpower; I was just using a analogy about how even countries that traditionally hate each other are uniting under a common goal)

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/543cbdbc6368722d79890200#post_543cbdbc6368722d79890200
Damn.
Although, I don't think bombing is a good idea.
For one it will probably destabilize the situation more, like with
 Libya.
ISIS probably has its sensitive targets in civilian areas like hospitals and schools. Common tactic. 

And you rarely win a war with only one strategy.

But why did they 'spare' the Christians? They had them, why did they let them leave?
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

Yeah; the bombings are destabilizing the region further and I totally agree that it's a total shit situation. I was pointing out that the only good thing about it was that so many countries are uniting against ISIS.  Like Seraphim said about a common foe.
